p: I enjoyed your letter of October 17 very much..At the present time, I have not had further word from Eastern Ken-tucky University regarding the loan of video tapes from your Epic America series. I do appreciate hearing from you regarding this matter and will certainly send along a copy of all correspondence with Kentucky relating to this matter.
I will look forward with great anticipation to visit-ing with you when you return to Columbia.

Eastern Kentucky University wants to borrow my "Epic America" tape, as I think you must know by now as there has been some correspondence.xxxx Also Syracuse University wants to obtain the "Twilight of the Sioux" tape. Since you know as much about those tapes as I do, I wish you could find time to meet with Don R. Mitchell, Associate Director of Instructional Television, and do what you can to clarify the matter. I have just written Mitchell, giving permission to loan the "Epic America" tape.

I think of you often, John, and always with the old warmth of heart. I have been doing a number of things for quite a while and have been kept really busy. At the same time I have been working on my autobiography, The Old Man Remembers, and I am happy about it. John, its going to be quite a book.</p
I am getting a bit eager to see you again and to find out how things go. Give my kind regards to any one in the English Department who would care for them. And be sure that you have my kindest thoughts always which you may share with your lady. And do hug the youngster for me. M.M.Y- Speeling of Switzer?
